image.altText: A young boy, crying, sits on a rock.

items.synopsis: Last week's earthquake destroyed every building in the remote village of Tikekht. Now anger is building as recovery efforts stall and newly orphaned children pick through the rubble with nowhere else to go.

title.children: The Moroccan town wiped off the map in one day

image.altText: A man looks at the camera.

items.synopsis: When Russian forces stormed Izium last year, the Ukrainian city was a hub for torture. One year later, the painstaking work to identify those responsible continues, with a little help from social media.

title.children: 'Drunk, violent' militia 'shot children': Report details more horrors of Russian occupation in Ukraine

image.altText: A close up shot of police tape with cars parked on a street and trees blurred in the background

items.synopsis: Detectives appeal for information after a man allegedly approached a 12-year-old girl in Warnbro on Monday and grabbed her shirt before she managed to escape.

title.children: Police investigating reports of alleged attempted child abduction in Perth's southern suburbs

image.altText: A man in a black suit leans into a microphone on a desk.

items.synopsis: Royal commissioner Nick Kaldas says he has "still not identified any strong evidence" to suggest defence is prioritising the mental health of its people in a sustainable way.

title.children: Veteran suicides royal commissioner accuses military brass of waiting to return to 'business as usual'

image.altText: A Qantas jet and a Jetstar jet sit on the tarmac at Melbourne Airport

items.synopsis: I’m not sure whether I’ve got any unclaimed Qantas flight credits. I haven’t looked, which is exactly what Qantas wants. Separating people determined to get their money from those who give up is a standard business practice, writes Peter Martin

title.children: Making refunds hard is standard practice — but Qantas appears to have added a twist

image.altText: An island with white sandy beaches, turquoise water, swaying palms and blue sky.

items.synopsis: Small island countries say they are sick of "empty promises" and want legally binding obligations clearly spelled out for major polluters at the International Tribunal on the Law of the Sea.

title.children: 'It is coming for us all': Why island nations are making their case at the Oceans Court

image.altText: Joe Biden speaks into two microphones and points forwards.

items.synopsis: Republican US House Speaker Kevin McCarthy orders an impeachment inquiry into the president, propelling congress toward a contentious and unlikely-to-succeed effort to remove him.

title.children: Republicans launch impeachment inquiry into US President Joe Biden

image.altText: Margherita pizza on a marble bench top with yellow melted cheese, fresh green basil leaves and red tomato sauce.

items.synopsis: Scratch beneath the surface of some of the origin stories of the world's most popular national dishes, and you'll find a big serve of controversy.

title.children: Love ramen, pizza or tacos? Their origins might surprise you

image.altText: Flinders Street Station in Melbourne's CBD

items.synopsis: A high-profile police incident that left one man dead and five others injured has put Melbourne residents on high alert, and raised questions over the city's safety.

title.children: Is Melbourne a safe city? As police beef up their presence, the question lingers

image.altText: A WA Police badge on an officer's shirt shoulder.

items.synopsis: A coronial inquest into the suicide of a young WA Police officer explores why he was able to access his police firearm at home.

title.children: Police officer who took his own life hid mental health issues at work, had gun at home, inquest told

image.altText: An elderly woman holds up a small poster that reads 'vote no', as part of a rally for the Indigenous Voice to Parliament.

items.synopsis: The No campaign has been accused of asking volunteers to spread "fear and misinformation" in an effort to convince referendum voters of its agenda.

title.children: Voice No campaign accused of asking volunteers to 'flat out lie'

image.altText: Two young women stand outdoors in a composite photo.

items.synopsis: For many young people, the referendum on the Indigenous Voice to Parliament will mark their first opportunity to vote. So how are they feeling about the vote?

title.children: Aria is a Yes, Kitana is a No. And young First Nations voters in between have other views

image.altText: An AFL player in a black training shirt, catches a football

items.synopsis: Collingwood star Brayden Maynard has successfully avoided a season-ending suspension at the AFL Tribunal, while Carton's Jack Martin had his ban downgraded from two games to one.

title.children: Collingwood's Brayden Maynard free to play preliminary final as rough conduct charge dismissed

image.altText: Michelle Wille sampling bird

items.synopsis: English is the common language of science, but it comes with downsides for scientists and our planet.

title.children: From virus detection to wildlife conservation — how language barriers in science could cost us dearly

image.altText: Close up/macro shot of bees crawling over each other inside a hive.

items.synopsis: The swarm of bees erupted from a hive dumped in a recycling bin, the contents of which had been transported to the Shire of Esperance's waste facility in Wylie Bay.

title.children: 'Very angry' bees shut down WA waste facility after hive is dumped in resident's recycling bin

image.altText: The outside of a grey office building.

items.synopsis: The Queensland biotech company, Xing Technologies, founded by prominent Brisbane oncologist and researcher Paul Mainwaring, rode a wave of favourable publicity in the late 2010s.

title.children: This high-profile biotech company's offices now sit empty, while shareholders are left in the dark

image.altText: A man stands on a balcony with a frown on his face.

items.synopsis: Insurance companies have responded to back-to-back floods and soaring building costs by hiking premiums by around 30 per cent in just one year. But for the riskiest homes, cover is either refused outright, or offered at prices few can afford.

title.children: The cost of Scott's home insurance tripled in three years. His insurer now refuses to cover his property

image.altText: a woman wearing dark glasses

items.synopsis: The Australian actor claims she was subjected to sexual harassment and discrimination during the show's run in Melbourne in 2014.

title.children: Actor Christie Whelan Browne sues Rocky Horror Show production company over alleged 'sexual harassment'

image.altText: A woman in a formal red dress stands in front of a lectern, with blue curtains behind her.

items.synopsis: Australia's new sex discrimination commissioner says she's appalled to hear former Coalition cabinet minister, Karen Andrews's accusations of harassment.

title.children: 'Appals me': Sex discrimination commissioner appalled to hear of Karen Andrews harassment allegations

image.altText: US gun violence

items.synopsis: Serious family and domestic violence offenders will not be able to own firearms or gun licences under the latest element of sweeping gun reform by the WA government.

title.children: Firearms and gun licence ban for DV offenders to be strengthened in response to spate of WA deaths

image.altText: A modern building.

items.synopsis: WA Minister for Sport David Templeman flags sweeping changes at the Western Australian Institute of Sport following the resignations of all but one board member and ongoing concerns about the culture of the organisation.

title.children: WAIS board replaced amid concerns of inaction over gymnast abuse

image.altText: Ngarra Murray smiles in a black top in front of a mural of historic Victorian Aboriginal leaders.

items.synopsis: The Aboriginal body negotiating treaty in Victoria says it has made a report to police after discovering a letter falsely attributed to one of its members spreading "outright lies and deception" in the state's north-west.

title.children: Victorian treaty body calls out 'shameful' fake letter spreading 'outright lies'

image.altText: Curtin Uni Wesley players stand arm in arm in a huddle during an Aussie rules match.

items.synopsis: Amateur female players call out derogatory and sexist online commentary after the Perth Football League A-grade grand final, saying "older men" are to blame for "disgusting" behaviour.

title.children: In shocking weather, an amateur women's footy team lost a low-scoring grand final — only to cop a sexist backlash

image.altText: A view from above shows flooding.

items.synopsis: More than 70 crocodiles have reportedly escaped from a farm in the Guangdong province after days of relentless rain following former Typhoon Haiku.

title.children: Seven people die, more than 70 crocodiles reportedly escape amid flooding in China

image.altText: A happy-looking older man gestures as he speaks into a microphone while wearing a suit.

items.synopsis: Mr Trump is facing a series of criminal cases in which he is charged, among other things, with trying to overturn his 2020 presidential election defeat.

title.children: Vladimir Putin says prosecution of Donald Trump shows US political system is 'rotten'

image.altText: A white man with short hair walks on a footpath in front of cars, wearing a suit, tie and dark glasses.

items.synopsis: Adam Green admits placing 1,170 bets on fixed matches in Ukraine from his Newcastle home.

title.children: Former Australian table tennis player avoids jail over $473K won on rigged matches

image.altText: A banner bearing the face of a young Indigenous man who died in custody.

items.synopsis: An expert in operational and combat tactics and training gives evidence about a neck restraint used by police on a 27-year-old Queensland man who died during an arrest.

title.children: Former special forces commando backs police at Steven Nixon-McKellar inquest

image.altText: Brisbane Watch House police entrance sign.

items.synopsis: Queensland Police Service has confirmed three members will have to undergo "remedial strategies".

title.children: 'It's an absolute joke': Queensland police officers in secret racist recordings to keep their jobs

image.altText: A young man in a suit outside a court

items.synopsis: Drew Pavlou says he was fined more than $1500 for his meme mocking the Chinese Communist Party.

title.children: Protester challenges 'unlawful' fine over anti Chinese Community Party meme

image.altText: Burnt-out cars

items.synopsis: Firefighters confirm sparks spread from a detached lithium-ion battery from a luxury electric car to four nearby vehicles parked at Sydney Airport last night.

title.children: Five cars destroyed at Sydney Airport after EV battery explosion

image.altText: The sun sets over Kakadu National Park.

items.synopsis: The Gundjeihmi Aboriginal Corporation says a "great burden has been removed" after ORIC confirmed the end of its long-running investigation, with no findings made and no actions to be taken.

title.children: Years-long investigation dropped into Aboriginal corporation representing Kakadu TOs
